Once-returner, non-returner, and so forth,
In the next life, attaining the fruit of a pratyekabuddha, and so forth - the third path.
Encountering the Buddha, having practiced,
In this body, attaining the first fruit,
Or as a family-to-family, seven-lifetime,
Once-returner, once-returner, and so forth,
Again cultivating the skillful means of the aggregates and so forth,
In the future,
Realizing the fruit of a pratyekabuddha's post-learner,
There are three kinds of practice.
The first is as stated in the text.
The second is because the previous path has two,
Practice also has two.
